alert.note: Alert for Boone; Dallas; Polk; Story (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 10:04AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Polk, Story, southern Boone and northeastern Dallas Counties through 1045 AM CDT... At 1004 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Madrid, or 12 miles south of Boone, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Big Creek Lake around 1010 AM CDT. Slater around 1015 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Huxley, Iowa State Center and Nevada. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 98 and 125. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
